channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Download: meet RFK Jr’s right-hand man, and inside OpenAI
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. Meet Jim O’N...

item.title: Goldman’s stock surges toward another record, as the ‘big winner’ of Fed’s stress tests
item.description: Bank stocks have outperformed the broad market with Goldman Sachs up 23% and JPMorgan Chase up 22% in the first half of 2025.

item.title: Robinhood shares soar as new crypto stock tokens open doors to overseas investors
item.description: The stock tokens give E.U. investors exposure to hundreds of U.S. stocks, as well as to private companies SpaceX and OpenAI.

item.title: My brother stole $100K from my mom to buy bitcoin. Do I convince her to sue him?
item.description: “He’s so manipulative.”

item.title: ‘He doesn’t seem to care’: My secretive father, 81, added my name to a bank account. What about my mom?
item.description: “Neither my mom nor I know anything about their finances.”

item.title: This major legal decision will power the stock market — and turbocharge your 401(k)
item.description: U.S. Supreme Court ruling supports industry deregulation — and the stock market hasn’t yet priced this in.

item.title: Meet Jim O’Neill, the longevity enthusiast who is now RFK Jr.’s right-hand man
item.description: When Jim O’Neill was nominated to be the second in command at the US Department of Health and Human Services, Dylan Livingston was excited. As founder...

item.title: Roundtables: Inside OpenAI’s Empire with Karen Hao
item.description: Recorded on June 30, 2025 AI journalist Karen Hao’s book, Empire of AI: Dreams and Nightmares in Sam Altman’s OpenAI, tells the story of OpenAI’s rise...

item.title: Identity theft hits 1.1M reports — and authentication fatigue is only getting worse
item.description: Why the authentication tug-of-war between friction and freedom will be won by those who can walk the tightrope between both.

item.title: MIT CSAIL’s new vision system helps robots understand their bodies
item.description: MIT CSAIL said the main barrier to affordable, flexible robotics isn't hardware, it's control of capability. The post MIT CSAIL’s new vision system he...

item.title: Between utopia and collapse: Navigating AI’s murky middle future
item.description: AI is disrupting the world, but it also presents an opportunity to ask what we are here for, and our role as stewards of meaning.

item.title: AI agents are hitting a liability wall. Mixus has a plan to overcome it using human overseers on high-risk workflows
item.description: Mixus's "colleague-in-the-loop" model blends automation with human judgment for safe deployment of AI agents.

item.title: Comau launches mobile robots, cobots, and exoskeletons at Automatica
item.description: Comau has added the myMR mobile robot, collaborative robots, and exoskeletons to its industrial automation offerings. The post Comau launches mobile r...

item.title: Distalmotion makes its first multirobot sale in the U.S.
item.description: Distalmotion said more than 2,000 Dexter procedures have been performed worldwide in general, gynecological, and urological surgery. The post Distalmo...

item.title: From hallucinations to hardware: Lessons from a real-world computer vision project gone sideways
item.description: What we tried, what didn't work and how a combination of approaches eventually helped us build a reliable computer vision model.

item.title: CTGT wins Best Presentation Style award at VB Transform 2025

item.title: Beep launches fully autonomous public transit system in Florida
